speakers.name: Minh Tri Pham
speakers.desc: Minh is a co-founder at Docucharm (funded by Y Combinator) and a former product manager at Uber.

speakers.name: Julia Neuschmid
speakers.desc: As a Senior Research Analyst for IDC Insights Europe, Julia contributes to the IDC Government Insights analysis within Europe, with special focus on Smart Cities. She conducts primary and secondary research with both IT vendors and end users on technology innovations to support sustainable development, improve resilience, meet citizens' expectations, and attract investment, new businesses, and talent in European cities.

speakers-bckp.name: Tomas Studenik
speakers-bckp.desc: Radical innovator and city hacker. Organizer of smart city hackathons CEE Hacks and Czech FuckUp Nights. Founder of multiple startups.

speakers-bckp.name: Cedric Maloux
speakers-bckp.desc: Serial entrepreneur for the past 22 years. Initially an engineer in AI, now running StartupYard, the oldest running startups accelerator in CEE.

speakers-bckp.name: Jiri Vicherek
speakers-bckp.desc: Specialist on PR and Content Marketing, startup mentor and founder of PR agency Fenek^^. Past director of Tyinternety.cz and Startup Summit.

speakers-bckp.name: Tomas Mikolov
speakers-bckp.desc: Research scientist at Facebook AI Research. Previously member of Google Brain team. Inventor of word2vec.

speakers-bckp.name: Dite Gashi
speakers-bckp.desc: Committed entrepreneur working on Decissio and Blocknify. Business-head MBA and Blockchain Developer with 6+ years of experience.

speakers-bckp.name: Bob Van Luijt
speakers-bckp.desc: Google Developer Expert. Founder of Kubrickology, creative technologist, artist and designer. Currently working on SeMI.

faq.a: We think of our hackathon as an "invention marathons" where participants have no restraints. Unlike other events, we donâ€™t want you to come up with a startup MVP or a solution to a corporate problem. It's whatever you want to build on top of any dataset with the aim to improve the quality of life in cities. Unleash your creativity and technical skills!

The main prize is â‚¬2000 (50 000 CZK), second best team will be awarded with â‚¬1200 (30 000 CZK) and the third best team with â‚¬400 (10 000 CZK). Additionally, there will be many other sponsored prizes.

There are many reason. Weâ€™ll name just a few though. You can come to enjoy a weekend of innovation and fun with 150 smartest technologists, to interact with the top European and American companies. There will also be workshops and talks by experienced professionals, free food and swag. And well, of course, prize money.

faq.q: Can I work in a team?
faq.a: Yes, you can work in a team of up to 4 people. If you come alone, you can participate in our team formation event at the beginning of the hackathon, where you can meet others with similar interests and complementary skillsets.
There will be no time to sleep. ðŸ˜› But you can always gather your strength or meditate for a little while in our chill room.

HackPrague developers and designers, including students and full-time employees. We will select participants based on their past projects, experience, and enthusiasm. We will aim to admit a diverse pool of people.

Relevance - Does it fit the theme - Smart Cities?
Technical Difficulty - Was it hard to make?
Polish - Was it presented nicely? 
 Creativity - Is it novel? 
 Usefulness - Does it have actual potential?
Not only is our hackathon 100% free to attend but weâ€™ll also provide you with free food, snacks and swag.

faq.q: Why are you organizing this event?
faq.a: We feel that Prague and the Central European region have a tremendous creative potential that hasnâ€™t yet been realized. Our mission is to become a platform for passionate technologists to meet, collaborate, and form relationships that extend well beyond the hackathon.
If you didnâ€™t find the answer to your question here, hit us up at team@hackprague.com.
